F1_technology.direction: AI capability curve steepening. Inference costs approaching near-zero for many applications. Robotics × AI compound effect validated. Automation boundary expanding from routine-cognitive toward tacit-cognitive tasks.

key_metrics.us_silver_tsunami: 52.3% of employer businesses owned by 55+, 2.34M businesses
key_metrics.japan_population: Declining ~900K/yr (UPGRADED from ~500K), leading indicator 5-7 years ahead
key_metrics.us_baumol_wages: $207B automatable wages, professional services +4%/yr vs CPI 2.5%
key_metrics.trades_shortage: 499K new workers needed in building trades (2026)
key_metrics.pipeline_collapse: CPA -33%, nursing 78K->200K, teaching 42 states, trucking age 57

F2_demographics.direction: Demographic forces are slow but inexorable. US Silver Tsunami creating acquisition opportunities in manufacturing and services. Japan 5-10 years ahead of US/EU in aging effects. India demographic dividend growing.

key_metrics.us_china_chip_controls: Expanding scope, parallel AI ecosystems forming
key_metrics.latam_nearshoring: Growing manufacturing FDI to Mexico, Brazil, Argentina
key_metrics.taiwan_risk: TSMC concentration, fab construction in US/Japan/EU
key_metrics.us_china_bifurcation: Two-ecosystem model: US subscription vs China open-source/free
key_metrics.deepseek: R1 captured 3%->13% global LLM share in 2 months
key_metrics.gulf_ai: Saudi Humain $77B, UAE MGX $25B, Abu Dhabi 5GW campus
key_metrics.defense_spending: $2,718B global (+9.4%), NATO 5% GDP target, DoD $13.4B AI line
key_metrics.chips_act: Intel 1.8nm HVM, TSMC Arizona volume, Samsung Taylor 90%+

F3_geopolitics.direction: US-China decoupling accelerating across technology, trade, and capital. EU regulatory divergence creating distinct transformation path. Nearshoring wave beginning to materialize in LATAM. Energy geopolitics remain volatile.

key_metrics.vc_rotation: Moving from pure-digital to hard-tech, robotics, physical economy

F4_capital.direction: Capital decisively rotating from digital/financial to physical/industrial. PE refinancing wall approaching. Financial services stocks signal active destruction. Business formation remains high despite rising delinquency = Schumpeterian rotation in progress.

key_metrics.generational_divide: Gen Z 67% excited vs Boomers 29% excited / 51% worried
key_metrics.trust_premium: 23% willing to pay 15-20% for human services
key_metrics.sector_resistance_map: Education 55% uncomfortable, Legal 82% ethical concerns, Healthcare 34-pt gap

F5_psychology.direction: FIRST QUANTIFICATION (v3-2). Adoption momentum decelerating due to psychology factors. 46% plateau is unprecedented S-curve flattening. Fear is a MARKET CREATOR ($86B fear economy), not just friction. Psychology determines adoption speed, not technology capability. Financial services (73% adoption) is the control group.

key_metrics.grid_bottleneck: 2,600 GW in queue, 5+ year wait — THE binding constraint on AI scaling
key_metrics.nuclear_renaissance: 10GW+ committed for AI (TMI restart, Kairos SMR, Talen)
key_metrics.lithium_surplus: Prices crashed 80% from 2022 peak, surplus through 2027
key_metrics.water_stress: 1.7B gallons/day for data center cooling globally
key_metrics.renewable_investment: $1.1T globally — first time exceeding fossil fuel investment

F6_energy.direction: FULLY CHARACTERIZED (v3-2). Grid bottleneck is THE binding constraint on AI transformation (2,600 GW in 5+ year queues). Nuclear renaissance underway for AI baseload. Solar at all-time low LCOE. Creates geographic winners (Texas, Southeast, Gulf) and losers (Northern Virginia). Data centers at 4%+ of grid, approaching 5% trigger.

sector_transformations.evidence_summary: PHASE UPGRADED to acceleration (v3-2). 54% customer interactions automated. 87% AI fraud detection at 92% interception. 339 branch closures. RPA->AI agents. Accounting displacement peak 2026-2028. CPA pipeline -33%. PE refinancing wall $936B-$1.8T. 9 supporting signals, zero contradictions.

Deepening (v3-2). $207B Baumol stored energy growing at 1.5pp/yr. 532K/month business applications. CPA -33%. Accounting entering displacement peak Phase 2 (2026-2028). Micro-firm OS demand emerging. 974K establishments, $1.07T payroll.

Deepening (v3-2). 78-point implementation gap (98% exploring, 20% ready). 73K cobots (+31% YoY). $34B->$155B manufacturing AI TAM. Silver Tsunami peak approaching. SBA 504 fee waiver through Sept 2026. China robot density 470/10K surpassed Germany/Japan.

CONFIDENCE UPGRADED medium->high (v3-2). 3%->22% AI adoption in 2 years via physician-invisible pathway. 66% physician usage. 295 FDA clearances in 2025. 78K unfilled RN positions growing to 200K. Trust barrier circumvented, not overcome. Healthcare admin $200B+ addressable.

Acceleration deepening (v3-2). RHI -53%, MAN -44%, KELYA -25%. Employment -7.6% YoY. 3.57M employees, $192.7B wages. Staffing intermediation becoming structurally redundant. PE-backed staffing roll-ups face refinancing wall + revenue collapse simultaneously.

Building trades shortage (499K workers needed). 230K establishments, 70% can't find workers. AI augmentation opportunity but high tacit-manual content = Baumol Premium, not Cure. Data center construction driving demand.
Zero-density Schumpeterian gap. 122K establishments. AI intermediation replacing human brokers. Coasean shrinkage. ZERO funded AI startups found.

demographic_profile.key_pressure: Silver Tsunami (52.3% of businesses owned by 55+), trades shortage
Most advanced aging economy, population declining ~500K/yr
Population decline onset, one-child policy effects, aging acceleration
Aging workforce, migration debates, productivity stagnation
Demographic dividend, youth employment challenge, digital leapfrog
Nearshoring beneficiary, young demographics, weak incumbents
Manufacturing migration from China, young workforce, variable AI readiness across nations
Energy transition pressure, sovereign wealth-driven AI investment, youth unemployment

running_patterns.description: Multi-Sector Baumol Cure: Healthcare, legal, accounting, insurance releasing stored above-CPI energy
running_patterns.economy_map_relevance: Defines the transformation path for NAICS 52, 54, 62 — routine cognitive middle collapses, judgment premium rises

running_patterns.description: Silver Tsunami: 52.3% of businesses owned by 55+, 2.34M businesses, 58% no succession plan
running_patterns.economy_map_relevance: Defines the transformation path for NAICS 31-33 manufacturing — acquisition-modernization wave incoming

running_patterns.description: Robotics × AI Compound: cobots $25-60K, 6-18mo ROI, $2.26B Q1 2026 funding
running_patterns.economy_map_relevance: Defines the transformation path for physical production — COGS compression in 12+ manufacturing sectors

running_patterns.description: Physical Architecture Dominance: physical sectors outperforming digital in durability scoring
running_patterns.economy_map_relevance: Capital rotation to physical/industrial is structural, not cyclical

running_patterns.description: Zero-Density Schumpeterian Gaps: wholesale, printing, food — zero AI startups despite strong forces
running_patterns.economy_map_relevance: Identifies sectors where transformation will be SUDDEN when it starts — no gradual adoption curve

running_patterns.description: Financial Services Cascade CONFIRMED: 7 data sources, active Schumpeterian destruction
running_patterns.economy_map_relevance: Financial services is the furthest-along sector transformation — real-time evidence of the cascade

running_patterns.description: Staffing Canary: RHI -53%, MAN -44%, KELYA -25% — strongest real-time market signal
running_patterns.economy_map_relevance: Administrative services (NAICS 56) transformation has entered acceleration phase

running_patterns.description: Global AI Ecosystem Bifurcation: US proprietary/subscription vs China open-source/free-access. DeepSeek 3%->13% share. Gulf as third node.
running_patterns.economy_map_relevance: Most significant geographic finding. Business models predicated on exclusive frontier access have 6-12 month windows. All geographic profiles require updating.

running_patterns.description: Reshoring Reality Gap: Record capital ($40.9B Mexico, $19B India) but US output +1%. Kearney Index -311. 2-5 year investment-to-production lag.
running_patterns.economy_map_relevance: Manufacturing models must account for 2-5 year lag between capital commitment and operational output. India emerging as primary alternative.

running_patterns.description: Defense AI Supercycle: $2,718B global (+9.4%), NATO 5% GDP target, DoD $13.4B AI/autonomy dedicated line, European rearmament +83%.
running_patterns.economy_map_relevance: Multi-decade structural commitment. Largest government spending outside AI infrastructure. Creates massive demand for autonomous systems, AI/ML, cybersecurity.

running_patterns.description: Gulf Oil-to-AI Conversion: $100B+ SWF AI infrastructure (Saudi Humain $77B, UAE MGX $25B). Fastest-moving compute investors globally.
running_patterns.economy_map_relevance: MENA geographic profile requires major upgrade. Gulf becoming primary AI infrastructure provider. Creates compute availability for Africa and South Asia.

running_patterns.description: Healthcare Invisible AI Pathway: Trust barrier circumvented via physician-tool adoption (66% usage). 3%->22% in 2 years. 295 FDA clearances in 2025.
running_patterns.economy_map_relevance: Defines healthcare AI adoption pathway: admin (low friction) -> physician tools (low-medium) -> patient-facing (high). Exposure effect erodes trust over 2-4 years.

key_unknowns: F5 Psychology adoption interventions: What breaks the 46% plateau? Technology alone is insufficient.
Second-order cascades: Financial Services acceleration -> CRE -> regional banks -> credit tightening chain not yet modeled.
Emergent economy categories: AI workforce platforms, fear economy, micro-firm OS — what other NAICS-incompatible categories are forming?
Year-specific timing: Most projections are ranges. Perez crash timing remains uncertain.
Labor migration paths: Where do displaced routine-cognitive workers actually go? Retraining outcomes unknown.
Defense AI sector: P-030 supercycle detected but no sector brief or model cards yet constructed.
Education sector: 55% discomfort but large Baumol opportunity. No sector brief yet.
China AI ecosystem capability: DeepSeek R1 shattered assumptions. How durable is bifurcation?
Gulf AI execution: $100B+ committed but operational capability unproven.
MENA geographic profile outdated: Gulf AI pivot makes current profile obsolete.
next_cycle_suggestions: PRIORITY 1: Migrate v2 model inventory (522 models) through 5-axis rating system
PRIORITY 2: Defense AI sector brief and model cards (P-030 supercycle, $2.72T global, NATO 5% GDP)
PRIORITY 3: Education sector brief (55% discomfort, high Baumol, large market)
PRIORITY 4: Second-order cascade modeling for Financial Services acceleration
PRIORITY 5: F5 Psychology adoption intervention research (breaking 46% plateau)
PRIORITY 6: MENA geographic profile overhaul (Gulf AI pivot makes current profile obsolete)
PRIORITY 7: Wholesale Trade zero-density refresh (P-022 staleness penalty accumulating)
